subject: And Speaking of Subterranean...
event:
... I am pleased to be able to announce that they have just signed up artist Marc Fishman to illustrate their deluxe limited edition of A DANCE WITH DRAGONS.

Don't know Fishman's work?  Go to http://www.marcfishman.com/ and check it out.  He's amazing, and it will be a real thrill to work with him.

I've actually had a Fishman cover once before.  His painting "The Return of the King" (which can be seen on the website) was used by my German publishers as the cover for one of their volumes of A FEAST FOR CROWS.  A gorgeous painting... but of course it has nothing to do with my books, Goldmann just plucked it out of their Big Box o' Fantasy Covers and decided it was close enough.  It's the best of the covers I've gotten on my German paperbacks, beyond a doubt, but all the same I'm jazzed to know that this time Marc will actually be painting the characters, scenes, and settings from my book.

If you'd like to get in the queue to snag a copy of the illustrated DANCE, it is never too late to drop by the SubPress website and place your order.

comments.article: Marc Fishman's work is exceptional. Looking forward to seeing what he does with DANCE :-)
omg awesome!!! He does such inspiring work. Thanks for the info.

I dunno. The central figure in "The Return of the King" looks just _like_ Tommen... except for the beard, the hair color, about three feet in height, and his sigil. Aside from that, the resemblance is quite striking.

Oh. Yeah. Dead Ringer. Give or take a few years.

That said, did you check out "Night" on page 4? AMAZING. I'm in love.

comments.upictitle: Popular series of fiction, fancy, and fact.: The classic madbard
comments.article:
For crying out loud, would you please post about...

Oh, wait. Cool!

Erm, doesn't there have to be an edition of Dance in order for them to publish a limited version of it?

Or are you just being coy? Odd, for that doesn't jibe with the GRRM I saw at WFC in Saratoga last year :-)
I noticed this, too.  I can only assume that it hasn't been listed yet.

Speaking of the Deluxe Limited Edition Dance, has anyone else seen the front cover for DANCE? I don't know whether this is legit or fake, so I won't confirm anything, but Wikipedia has uploaded a cover for the novel.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Dance_with_Dragons

Well, the source for the image on Wikipedia is listed as the Amazon page for the book, and on that page, there is a RELEASE DATE listed. That is, if you are to trust Amazon. The supposed release date is September 30 of this year. Supposedly. Amazon also claims that the book is 1008 pages. Go look at the page for yourself: http://www.amazon.com/Dance-Dragons-George-R-R-Martin/dp/0553801473/ref=pd_bbs_sr_1?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1203737182&sr=8-1
I would be deeply hurt if Amazon had accurate information about the release of this book before we, George's loyal fans, did.
comments.subject: Release Dage?

comments.article:
WHUT? O_o OMG.

Oh dear lord, I need to find someone with a credit card now! I Subb Press covers Philippines...if not...I WILL FIND A WAY!
I've always wondered what happens to the cover paintings. Do they give them to the author? Does the painter keep them? Can't wait to see it though.
well correct me if im wrong...but does this mean that the DANCE is finally ready?....
comments.subject: sooo...

comments.article:
No. As I have said before, when DANCE is done, I will post the news on my Update page.

I am trying to finish by the middle of June, however. These announcements are predicated on me being able to do that.

If I do not, in fact, deliver the finished before before the end of June, all bets are off.

And Amazon pub dates are almost always made of hope and vapor.
comments.subject: Re: sooo...

comments.article: can someone tell me where i must place the order?...i got no idea...
comments.subject: me again...

comments.article:
Go to the Subterranean Press website at http://www.subterraneanpress.com/

You may only be able to get on a waiting list. First priority for buying the limited of DANCE goes to those who have purchased the previous limiteds from SubPress, and it may be possible that all copies are committed.

There are always cancellations and dropouts, however. If so, the earlier you get your name on the waiting list, the better.
comments.subject: ordering the limited

comments.article: Ooh, I can't wait to see the finished product! Good cover art is kinda hard to come by sometimes--it's rare to see an artist's interpretation of characters that ultimately results in art actually looking like the characters. I keep thinking of Darrell Sweet's covers for Jordan's "The Wheel of Time" series. Somehow, Sweet always manages to make Rand and his friends look about 40 years old. Looking at your cover gallery, I have to be honest and say that some of the covers for your books around the world either inaccurately depict certain characters (like the dragons being huge or Jon Snow looking to be about 30) and events, or else don't appear to have anything to do with the series. I have to wonder how many artists actually -read- the character descriptions before working on a cover--or if they do, then I have to wonder what exactly they're reading and who is providing them with such skewed descriptions. I'm not familiar with the publishing process, so all I can do is wonder. Over the years, I have found that I prefer plain covers to cover art, but on the rare occasions that a cover is accurate and well-drawn, then it's truly an amazing experience. Marc Fishman is definitely one of those exceptional artists, and I hope he'll be able to accurately interpret your literary vision.
Excellent stuff =)
Talented man.
If you finish by June, I swear I'll jump for joy!!!
I hope he can paint faster than some authors can write!..  (Of course I consider it an achievement to READ an entire book -- let alone write one!)
comments.subject: How fast can this Marc guy paint I wonder?!

comments.article: I was hoping to read the new book right after my son was born....in December of '06. I love these books so much; my family is sick of me talking about them. Anyway, happy writing.

I'm not an art historian, but he reminds me of the pre-raphaelites. Say, there's a thought:
BARRY WINDSOR-SMITH!
comments.subject: Lovely stuff

comments.article:
I just picked up the signed copy of Fevre Dream from Pat's Fantasy Hotlist contest. I almost fainted from shock when I opened the box and realised what it was! It's gorgeous, and I'm very happy to have it. Definitely worth trekking through the snowstorm to find out what had been delivered for me!

Thanks Mr. Martin!
Classic and somber.  A good fit for ASOIAF, methinks.
comments.subject: Looks good!

comments.article:
I love those optimists at Amazon.com. September 30th! Whenever I get it I'll read it too fast and start jonesing for the next one, so might as well chill. I would like to re-read Feast for Crows first, though. I love that crazy Arya chick. She is the truest of the Starks. She is her old man through and through.
ps Love the cover.
comments.subject: I just pre-ordered my DWD!

comments.article: Pretty unrelated, but I was talking with my SO last night about Fevre Dream and how she needs to have read it, like yesterday and it dawned on me. Why is there no riverboat racing board game? That would be toasted awesome on a kick arse cracker.
